thread.title: Utah football: Utes rise to No. 5 in the AP poll, No. 7 in coaches
thread.title_full: Utah football: Utes rise to No. 5 in the AP poll, No. 7 in coaches | The Salt Lake Tribune

author: MATTHEW PIPER
title: Utah football: Utes rise to No. 5 in the AP poll, No. 7 in coaches
text:
Inactive Utah scored big points with voters this weekend, moving from No. 10 to No. 5 in the AP poll and No. 12 to No. 7 in the coaches poll. The AP ranking is Utah's highest since Jan. 8, 2009, when it had just won the Sugar Bowl, and the highest regular-season ranking since reaching No. 5 in November 2004.
More importantly: Without moving a muscle, the Utes found themselves alone atop the Pac-12 South.
Last week's No. 3 (AP)/5 (coaches) Ole Miss, No. 6/7 Notre Dame, No. 7/10 UCLA and No. 8/6 Georgia all lost, as did Pac-12 South brethren Colorado and Arizona.
  Only three teams remain unbeaten in Pac-12 Conference play, and two of those, Utah and Cal, meet Saturday at Rice-Eccles with ESPN's " College GameDay " on hand. 
(If Utah has to play No. 16/18 Stanford, which sits at 3-0 in conference, it will be in the Pac-12 Championship Game.)
Utah's previous high rank by this point in the season came in 2010, when it was 10th in both polls. Since going undefeated and finishing No. 2 in the 2008 AP poll, it's ranked as high as No. 6 in both polls in 2010, when No. 3 TCU beat Utah 47-7 during a "GameDay" visit.
There is a highly unusual divergence of opinion about the Utes. Last week they became the first team ranked so low (No. 10) to get a first-place AP vote by that late in the season since No. 10 Hawaii, in 2007. Sunday, they received seven first-place votes from AP voters while getting eight of No. 10-and-up, including one of No. 14. The Utes were also the lowest-ranked team to get a first-place vote in the coaches poll.
Oregon, which Utah thumped 62-20 in Eugene, took a little longer than Ute fans might've liked to pull away from Colorado in Boulder, but No. 18/21 Michigan has fast become a credible "best win." The Wolverines beat Maryland 28-0 and have now outscored opponents 122-14 since leaving Salt Lake City. Utah State also rebounded from consecutive losses to Pac-12 teams in a convincing win against Colorado State .
Fox Sports' Bruce Feldman and Stewart Mandel both figure Utah No. 1, as does ESPN's Brett McMurphy and the San Jose Mercury News' Jon Wilner .
Tweeted USA Today's Dan Wolken : "Any poll where Utah isn't No. 1 is wrong."
Looking ahead beyond No. 23/22 Cal, Utah hosts an Arizona State team that sprang to life in Pasadena — as the Utes did exactly one year ago Sunday — and then visits a No. 17/17 USC squad that routed the Sun Devils.

mpiper@sltrib.com 
Twitter: @matthew_piper
